To execute Python statements, the statements must be entered into a file
Python's print statement writes items to the screen.
A full list of Python keywords can be obtained from Python itself, using the Python keyword module.
A variable called name refers to the same value as a variable called NAME.
The keyword function marks the beginning of a function definition.
Python determines the beginning and end of a statement based on whitespace.
Function int retrieves an integer from a program user.
Python has three high-level data structures: lists, dictionaries and hashes.
Tuples are immutable data types; lists are mutable data types.
